attributes.action: Support the UK's hospitality industry through the Coronavirus crisis
attributes.additional_details: The hospitality industry is the third largest industry in the UK with many thousands of jobs at stake. Choosing not to officially close restaurants, bars, hotels and other venues and instead putting the onus on consumers and business owners is both a dangerous and unfair decision. Businesses cannot make insurance claims for business interruption in this situation. Other countries have declared large sums for support of SMEs including in hospitality, the UK Government must do the same.
attributes.background:
We need:

Funding (VAT payment holidays, contributions to cover wages and fixed costs, legislation to defer rent and utilities) while businesses are affected.

An order to close rather than advice to the public not to go out, so customers have clarity and businesses can claim against insurance.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302162

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
